channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CLEAR: Improving Vision-Language Navigation with Cross-Lingual, Environment-Agnostic Representations
item.description: Empirically, on the Room-Across-Room dataset, we show that our multilingual agent gets large improvements in all metrics over the strong baseline model when generalizing to unseen environments with the cross-lingual language representation and the environment-agnostic visual representation.

item.title: ReMix: A General and Efficient Framework for Multiple Instance Learning based Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: We evaluate ReMix on two public datasets with two state-of-the-art MIL methods.

item.title: CodeRL: Mastering Code Generation through Pretrained Models and Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To address the limitations, we propose "CodeRL", a new framework for program synthesis tasks through pretrained LMs and deep reinforcement learning (RL).

item.title: Open-Vocabulary Multi-Label Classification via Multi-modal Knowledge Transfer
item.description: Specifically, our method exploits multi-modal knowledge of image-text pairs based on a vision and language pretraining (VLP) model.

item.title: Attention Guided Network for Salient Object Detection in Optical Remote Sensing Images
item.description: Specifically, the position enhancement stage consists of a semantic attention module and a contextual attention module to accurately describe the approximate location of salient objects.

item.title: Accelerating Score-based Generative Models with Preconditioned Diffusion Sampling
item.description: However, a fundamental limitation is that their inference is very slow due to a need for many (e. g., 2000) iterations of sequential computations.

item.title: Learning Local Implicit Fourier Representation for Image Warping
item.description: In this paper, we propose a local texture estimator for image warping (LTEW) followed by an implicit neural representation to deform images into continuous shapes.

item.title: Detecting and Recovering Sequential DeepFake Manipulation
item.description: Moreover, we build a comprehensive benchmark and set up rigorous evaluation protocols and metrics for this new research problem.

item.title: Efficient Spatial-Temporal Information Fusion for LiDAR-Based 3D Moving Object Segmentation
item.description: We also use a point refinement module via 3D sparse convolution to fuse the information from both LiDAR range image and point cloud representations and reduce the artifacts on the borders of the objects.

item.title: Transformer based Models for Unsupervised Anomaly Segmentation in Brain MR Images
item.description: The restricted receptive field in CNNs limit the CNN to model the global context and hence if the anomalous regions cover parts of the image, the CNN-based AEs are not capable to bring semantic understanding of the image.

item.title: Features Based Adaptive Augmentation for Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Self-Supervised learning aims to eliminate the need for expensive annotation in graph representation learning, where graph contrastive learning (GCL) is trained with the self-supervision signals containing data-data pairs.

item.title: "Even if ..." -- Diverse Semifactual Explanations of Reject
item.description: In this work, we propose to explain rejects by semifactual explanations, an instance of example-based explanation methods, which them self have not been widely considered in the XAI community yet.

item.title: Vector Quantisation for Robust Segmentation
item.description: The reliability of segmentation models in the medical domain depends on the model's robustness to perturbations in the input space.

item.title: Improving Covariance Conditioning of the SVD Meta-layer by Orthogonality
item.description: Inserting an SVD meta-layer into neural networks is prone to make the covariance ill-conditioned, which could harm the model in the training stability and generalization abilities.

item.title: Neural Networks and the Chomsky Hierarchy
item.description: Reliable generalization lies at the heart of safe ML and AI.

item.title: Multi-modal Robustness Analysis Against Language and Visual Perturbations
item.description: In this work, we perform the first extensive robustness study of such models against various real-world perturbations focusing on video and language.

item.title: SESS: Saliency Enhancing with Scaling and Sliding
item.description: High-quality saliency maps are essential in several machine learning application areas including explainable AI and weakly supervised object detection and segmentation.

item.title: The StarCraft Multi-Agent Challenges+ : Learning of Multi-Stage Tasks and Environmental Factors without Precise Reward Functions
item.description: This challenge, on the other hand, is interested in the exploration capability of MARL algorithms to efficiently learn implicit multi-stage tasks and environmental factors as well as micro-control.

item.title: Distance Matters in Human-Object Interaction Detection
item.description: 2) Insufficient number of distant interactions in benchmark datasets results in under-fitting on these instances.

item.title: RepMix: Representation Mixing for Robust Attribution of Synthesized Images
item.description: Uniquely, we present a solution to this task capable of 1) matching images invariant to their semantic content; 2) robust to benign transformations (changes in quality, resolution, shape, etc.)

item.title: PRoA: A Probabilistic Robustness Assessment against Functional Perturbations
item.description: Our experiments demonstrate the effectiveness and flexibility of PRoA in terms of evaluating the probabilistic robustness against a broad range of functional perturbations, and PRoA can scale well to various large-scale deep neural networks compared to existing state-of-the-art baselines.

item.title: A Unified Meta-Learning Framework for Dynamic Transfer Learning
item.description: Transfer learning refers to the transfer of knowledge or information from a relevant source task to a target task.

item.title: NeuralPassthrough: Learned Real-Time View Synthesis for VR
item.description: Virtual reality (VR) headsets provide an immersive, stereoscopic visual experience, but at the cost of blocking users from directly observing their physical environment.

item.title: PoF: Post-Training of Feature Extractor for Improving Generalization
item.description: We developed a training algorithm called PoF: Post-Training of Feature Extractor that updates the feature extractor part of an already-trained deep model to search a flatter minimum.

item.title: An Intrusion Detection System based on Deep Belief Networks
item.description: The CICIDS2017 dataset was used to train and evaluate the performance of our proposed DBN approach.

item.title: Understanding and Improving Group Normalization
item.description: Various normalization layers have been proposed to help the training of neural networks.

item.title: Generating Game Levels of Diverse Behaviour Engagement
item.description: Recent years, there has been growing interests in experience-driven procedural level generation.

item.title: Egocentric Video-Language Pretraining @ Ego4D Challenge 2022
item.description: In this report, we propose a video-language pretraining (VLP) based solution \cite{kevin2022egovlp} for four Ego4D challenge tasks, including Natural Language Query (NLQ), Moment Query (MQ), Object State Change Classification (OSCC), and PNR Localization (PNR).

item.title: Harmonizer: Learning to Perform White-Box Image and Video Harmonization
item.description: Unlike prior methods that are based on black-box autoencoders, Harmonizer contains a neural network for filter argument prediction and several white-box filters (based on the predicted arguments) for image harmonization.

item.title: Learning Optimal Transport Between two Empirical Distributions with Normalizing Flows
item.description: Each of these functions is associated to one sub-flow of the network, whose output provides intermediate steps of the transport between the original and target measures.

item.title: Back to MLP: A Simple Baseline for Human Motion Prediction
item.description: This paper tackles the problem of human motion prediction, consisting in forecasting future body poses from historically observed sequences.

item.title: Probing via Prompting
item.description: We then examine the usefulness of a specific linguistic property for pre-training by removing the heads that are essential to that property and evaluating the resulting model's performance on language modeling.

item.title: Open-world Semantic Segmentation for LIDAR Point Clouds
item.description: Current methods for LIDAR semantic segmentation are not robust enough for real-world applications, e. g., autonomous driving, since it is closed-set and static.

item.title: Anomaly-aware multiple instance learning for rare anemia disorder classification
item.description: Deep learning-based classification of rare anemia disorders is challenged by the lack of training data and instance-level annotations.

item.title: A New Index for Clustering Evaluation Based on Density Estimation
item.description: An experiment is conducted to test the performance of the new index, and compared with three popular internal clustering evaluation indices -- Calinski-Harabasz index, Silhouette coefficient, and Davies-Bouldin index, on a set of 145 datasets.

item.title: Detection of ADHD based on Eye Movements during Natural Viewing
item.description: Attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a neurodevelopmental disorder that is highly prevalent and requires clinical specialists to diagnose.

item.title: CPrune: Compiler-Informed Model Pruning for Efficient Target-Aware DNN Execution
item.description: We propose CPrune, a compiler-informed model pruning for efficient target-aware DNN execution to support an application with a required target accuracy.

item.title: Invariant and Transportable Representations for Anti-Causal Domain Shifts
item.description: In this paper, we study representation learning under a particular notion of domain shift that both respects causal invariance and that naturally handles the "anti-causal" structure.

item.title: TANet: Transformer-based Asymmetric Network for RGB-D Salient Object Detection
item.description: We employ the powerful feature extraction capability of Transformer (PVTv2) to extract global semantic information from RGB data and design a lightweight CNN backbone (LWDepthNet) to extract spatial structure information from depth data without pre-training.

item.title: Robot Vitals and Robot Health: Towards Systematically Quantifying Runtime Performance Degradation in Robots Under Adverse Conditions
item.description: This paper addresses the problem of automatically detecting and quantifying performance degradation in remote mobile robots during task execution.

item.title: Aug-NeRF: Training Stronger Neural Radiance Fields with Triple-Level Physically-Grounded Augmentations
item.description: Inspired by that, we propose Augmented NeRF (Aug-NeRF), which for the first time brings the power of robust data augmentations into regularizing the NeRF training.

item.title: DeepPyramid: Enabling Pyramid View and Deformable Pyramid Reception for Semantic Segmentation in Cataract Surgery Videos
item.description: Semantic segmentation in cataract surgery has a wide range of applications contributing to surgical outcome enhancement and clinical risk reduction.

item.title: Removing Batch Normalization Boosts Adversarial Training
item.description: In addition, NoFrost achieves a $23. 56\%$ adversarial robustness against PGD attack, which improves the $13. 57\%$ robustness in BN-based AT.

item.title: Understanding Performance of Long-Document Ranking Models through Comprehensive Evaluation and Leaderboarding
item.description: We carry out a comprehensive evaluation of 13 recent models for ranking of long documents using two popular collections (MS MARCO documents and Robust04).

item.title: Task-oriented Self-supervised Learning for Anomaly Detection in Electroencephalography
item.description: Compared to supervised learning with labelled disease EEG data which can train a model to analyze specific diseases but would fail to monitor previously unseen statuses, anomaly detection based on only normal EEGs can detect any potential anomaly in new EEGs.

item.title: Partial and Asymmetric Contrastive Learning for Out-of-Distribution Detection in Long-Tailed Recognition
item.description: However, in real-world applications, it is common for the training sets to have long-tailed distributions.

item.title: Large-scale Robustness Analysis of Video Action Recognition Models
item.description: The study reveals some interesting findings, 1) transformer based models are consistently more robust against most of the perturbations when compared with CNN based models, 2) Pretraining helps Transformer based models to be more robust to different perturbations than CNN based models, and 3) All of the studied models are robust to temporal perturbation on the Kinetics dataset, but not on SSv2; this suggests temporal information is much more important for action label prediction on SSv2 datasets than on the Kinetics dataset.

item.title: Egocentric Video-Language Pretraining @ EPIC-KITCHENS-100 Multi-Instance Retrieval Challenge 2022
item.description: In this report, we propose a video-language pretraining (VLP) based solution \cite{kevin2022egovlp} for the EPIC-KITCHENS-100 Multi-Instance Retrieval (MIR) challenge.

item.title: Deep Contrastive One-Class Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: The accumulation of time series data and the absence of labels make time-series Anomaly Detection (AD) a self-supervised deep learning task.

item.title: Variational Neural Networks
item.description: Bayesian Neural Networks (BNNs) provide a tool to estimate the uncertainty of a neural network by considering a distribution over weights and sampling different models for each input.
